title: D. B. Updike's Books
content:
Hi.

I am not a font designer, nor a graphic designer, but I’ve been insane for fonts since I was in my early teens (many, many moons ago), long before computer based font tools...

In any case, I’m looking for a book that someone out there might have of know where can be obtained... I have Volume Two of D. B. Updike’s “Printing Types; Their history, forms, and use, a study in survivals”, second edition, 1937. I’d like volume one as well.

Thanks!

 [‹ Zapfino, now with OpenType contextual features!](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106045547/http:/www.typophile.com/node/8122 "Go to previous forum topic") [Where'd that "peek into my workspace" thread go? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106045547/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16403 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jbottero

comments.content: A quick [search](http://web.archive.org/web/20071106045547/http:/dogbert.abebooks.com/servlet/SearchResults?an=updike&y=0&tn=%22printing+types%22&x=0) on abebooks revealed several good candidates for you, starting around the $20 price. I have both volumes and can recommend them.
I’ve never been to that web site. Thanks!
